hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When a significant negative macro catalyst (e.g., regulatory, inflation) triggers a sharp, high-volume sell-off in BTC (>5% drop in <4 hours), the subsequent 24-hour period will see a mean-reverting bounce of at least 50% of the initial drop, as panic selling exhausts and algorithmic buyers step in at perceived oversold levels.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp, news-driven sell-offs often overextend due to forced liquidations and emotional trading. Once the liquidation cascade subsides, the market tends to partially retrace as volatility normalizes and value buyers enter. Negative funding rates provide a short-term incentive for longs.
entry_conditions: BTC 4hr close down >5% on volume >150% of 20-period average
Event occurs during NEUTRAL or BULL regime (per FjordHQ regime filter)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial catalyst-driven drop (measured from pre-catalyst high to post-catalyst low)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the post-catalyst low by 2%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such events see continued selling or consolidation without a 50% retracement within 48 hours.
